reviews.title: Great location,Art deco atmosphere
reviews.text: I would be more than happy to stay at this hotel again.
My mother and I stayed 3 nights here,and if some of our fellow guests had been a little quieter and more considerate late at night,I would have had no qualms at all!
reviews.title: Holy Cow What a Great Deal!!!!

likes.liked: — The great brasserie and comfortable beds.
likes.disliked: — the tatty carpets and smell of smoke

reviews.title: very good
reviews.text: Of course it is not the hotel's fault,but I ( and another guest in a nearby room) had to bang on the wall to notify next-door that we could hear their loud conversation and blaring TV in our room at 11.30 pm after we had retired after a hard day's walking,(to their credit,they toned it down at once),but why people have to slam bedroom doors late at night is a mystery to me...Sound-proofing is a tricky issue!However,the double-glazing on the windows meant that the street noise was minimal.
Still,gripe aside,this hotel has a first class location seconds from the Metro,great shops,cafes and restaurants.It's a lovely neighbourhood.
reviews.title: Great Value for Paris

reviews.text: The staff were charming and professional,and the room was clean,with comfortable beds,good facilities.I had requested a street view and we got one.
reviews.title: Pick Your Room Carefully

likes.disliked: — you have to be very careful about which room you get

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: "Beautiful Hotel Lutetia - a truly memorable experience, six days from 17th to 21st August this year, a gorgeous Art Deco building and famous landmark right in the heart of one of the loveliest areas in Paris. Paris is my favourite city in the world and we travel here regularly each year but this was my first time at this lovely venue and we were not disappointed in any way. Our lovely room on the fifth floor facing the courtyard was quiet as requested with a beautiful spacious marble bathroom with excellent fixtures and fittings, a good power shower and good quality toiletries. I have to admit the room itself was slightly smaller than the one I had been expecting because I like the room to be approached by a small hallway as shown on the internet but we had an exceptionally good deal from Expedia and the hotel was unusually busy for August. However, in retrospect we were very happy there and because it was so quiet will probably request the same room on our next visit. I have been disappointed to read complaints but obviously the Plaza Athenae, Bristol or Ritz would be happy to accommodate those who can afford a more upmarket venue for five to seven days. In Europe I find if you don't like your room or have problems and you are as polite and courteous as the Europeans they are usually happy to do their best for you wherever you are whether its changing a table in a restaurant or a particular hotel room. On arrival the black and white tiled floor, velvet sofas, chandeliers, stained glass windows and the general glamour and style of the hotel creates a lovely and welcoming ambience. I adored the jazz bar with its fabulous 20's style, red velvet drapes, sofas, and amazing black statue dividing the piano area from the seating and have to say I could have been there every night quite happily and between the two restaurants perhaps never have left the hotel!! I too again enjoyed the Brasserie Lutetia which I had been to previously - in fact we had a kir royale and a delicious lobster salad there for our last luncheon. I look forward to "Le Paris" the major restaurant but sadly it was closed in August. Because of our long lunches we did not visit the breakfast room for the buffet but I have no doubt the standard would be also excellent. The "Lutetia" ofcourse diagonally faces a lovely little park and leads to my favourite department store Bon Marche and is very close to the beloved people watching "Les Deux Magots" which I love. The metro Sevres Babylon takes you anywhere you want to go all over Paris with trains flying in every two minutes. My birthday was celebrated at "La Grande Cascade" a beautiful palace restaurant set in the beautiful Bois du Boulogne, would have been in the gardens but on a duller day I was more than happy to enjoy the opulence, magnificent cuisine and splendid service of the interior. Another lovely lunch was at the gorgeous brasserie "Montparnasse 1900" with its delicious and very affordable set menu and stunning mirrored and belle epoque fixtures and fittings. Musee des Arts Decoratifs has now been fully renovated and a wonderful experience with lunch at the new modern restaurant "Le Saut du Loup". Also went to some lovely exhibitions but just walking the streets of Paris and along the River Seine is an unforgettable treat in itself. Staying at "Hotel Lutetia" was a beautiful experience for us and we look forward to our return and hope everyone enjoys it as much as we do. I say "do" and not "did" as I know we will return again and again.
reviews.title: Hotel Lutetia - a beautiful hotel for a magical holiday in Paris

likes.liked: — Art deco charm, very quiet lovely room and beautiful bathroom and toiletries
likes.disliked: — Nothing. Loved it but as I say prefer a little hallway but absolutely no complaints.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent five nights at this hotel and found it to be serviceable, but that's about it. When we first arrived and checked into our room, we immediately went back down to reception and requested a different room. The first room was old, worn, in desperate need of upgrading and certainly not worth $550.00 american dollars per night. They did give us a different room which was better (but still not worth $550.00 a night), but there was a huge stain on the carpet. One evening when we got back to the hotel wanting to shower and get ready for the evening, we found that we had no hot water and that the water coming out of the faucet was black. When we called the front desk we were informed that they were working on the water and that there would be no hot water in the hotel for at least an hour. This hotel is very much overrated and is in need of upgrading. We found the city of Paris to be absolutely beautiful and the French people to be friendly and helpful, while, with just a few exceptions, the staff at the Lutecia were not. I would not stay here again, nor could I recommend this property.
reviews.title: Find another hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: room rate E550! (level 2) Shabby chipped and scraped wallpaper and skirting. Public convenience style White tiled large bathroom which smelt of drains (there was a drain in the middle of the floor filled with dust and hair ) and had useless shower. Overlooked a courtyard of gravel and other rooms. Nothing looked clean and there was only one pillow each....with one pillow spare in a cupboard.
reviews.title: shabby, overpriced bedrooms

reviews.text: Just room to move around the bed with annex just holding small writing table. Room and bathroom the same size.
reviews.title: Run… don’t walk… away from this hotel!

likes.disliked: — Neglect of guest room, lack of cleanliness, smell

reviews.text: Shaving mirror in the bathroom was set at 3 foot high on the opposite wall from the basin.
reviews.title: Loved It!!!

reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at the Lutetia. It's a great location if you want to go to the Museums. My husband and I only took one cab the enitre time we were there and never had to get on the Metro! Yes, there were two nights that we were there and the hot water was not on for a few hours. The room service food the first night was outstanding but didn't get to those heights again during our stay. We had a nice room up on the 6th floor, with plenty of room to move around and decent size bathroom.
reviews.title: Wonderful Location

likes.liked: — The location, we were able to walk every where we wanted to go!

reviews.title: Very Dissappointed in the Lutetia
reviews.text: We enjoyed Le Bon Marche's epicurien centre. It was wonderful to be able to buy some nice wine, cheese, pastries & bread for a little in room feast!
This hotel is old, it sounds like the rooms can be hit or miss. We were lucky to get a nice room with breakfast included. I would stay here again but that is all due to the great location!
reviews.title: Very good stay at the Lutetia
Enjoyed Our Stary
reviews.text: Our stay at the Lutetia was a dreadful experience. Our room as well as the hallway was dark, dingy and smelled strongly of smoke even though it was supposed to be non smoking area. With only two small bedside lamps with perhaps 40 watt bulbs in each, it was impossible to read. There was no water pressure so a bath was out of the question and even a shower took forever. The bath area was rather drab and felt like it had not been cleaned properly. Our converter and adapter did not work nor did the two different ones the hotel sent to our room. This resulted in two rather expensive pieces of travel equipment being ruined. My cell phone was taken from our room and the management was totally unconcerned and of no help in trying to determine who had taken it. (The door was locked and only their staff had access to the room.) We were in a Superior room at E400+ per night, so I shiver to think of what the lesser priced rooms were like. The lobby and bar area are charming and access to the metro is right across the street but those are the only redeeming qualities. We have stayed in wonderful hotels in Paris, but the Lutetia is not one of them.

We just returned from a one week stay in Paris (from 10/3-10/10/07) and stayed at the Hotel Lutetia. I was VERY concerned about previous ratings and this is the first time I have written in a review. I would like to say that the negative comments were completely unfounded. The rooms were fine. Unfortunately, we could not upgrade to a suite or a room with a view, because most of the rooms in the city were taken up by the World Cup Rugby finals. It didn't matter. The bathroom was large and new, the room was a nice size and quiet, and the bed was very comfortable. There was no "smokiness" which had been previously reported and the service was fine. I have only two complaints about the room. The drawers were old and hard to open and the television/movies did not work, despite repeated phone calls to the front desk. Other than these two relatively minor issues everything else was great. The buffet breakfast each morning was excellent. The concierges and front desk personnel were extremely helpful, courteous, and had no issues with our inability to speak French. It is a GREAT location for finding quality dining, shopping, strolling, and particularly easy access to get to anywhere in Paris from the Metro across the street. I would stay there again in a minute given the opportunity.
reviews.title: Avoid this place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first visit to Paris and we don't speak french so I was a little apprehensive about the language barrier but when we arrived at the front desk of Hotel Lutetia we were greeted by the friendliest staff we have ever met. It was a great welcome to a new country and it really set the tone for our trip. Also the concierge was very friendly too. He helped us locate the open tour bus stops with a map and quickly flagged down a cab when we needed one.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and friendly staff

reviews.text: The room was very nice (although a bit small) but it was very clean and there was nothing really to complain about. We didn't spend much time in our room because there was just so much to see in Paris. The hotel lobby was very nice too.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, we have stayed here a few times

likes.liked: — The food was wonderful and the room was very comfortabble.
likes.disliked: — Only Sleeps two, had to pay for two rooms for my family.. Common in Paris though

reviews.text: I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends although for people looking to stay right in the heart of some party areas you might want to try getting a hotel in the Latin Quarter or somewhere with more of a party scene. That being said, Hotel Lutetia is in walking distance to many of the great landmarks and cafes in Paris and we'd definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Loved It

likes.liked: — Location, right by a tube stop. It was nice to walk out and get right on the tube.

reviews.text: This is such a wonderful Hotel. We've stayed here several times with our two children 10 and 12 years old. We get adjoining rooms and both rooms are always spacious and beautifully decorated. The morning brunch is included and is always fresh, delicious and kid friendly. We are from the USA and the staff are always friendly and very helpful to us. The atttached restaurant is one the the best and my daughter's favorite. We took only one taxi ride and the rest of the time we walked. We have stayed at the Lutetia several times and each time we've enjoyed it. We will be going again this summer.
reviews.title: mixed bag

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I work for America Airlines Vacations. I went to go saty at this hotelw for five nioghts. The Hotel it self is very nice. It was an older hotel but so are alot of the hotes in Paris. The front desk and all the staff are very nice. (for being french). The room were a little smaller than I am use to but I saw all the hotels in paris and unless you are willing to pay 10,000 USD for a five night saty at the ritz than you have to expect that your room is going to be a little smaller. The bath room was nice and clean. The views here good. Even know i did not get a view of the Eiffel it was nice views of the city.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Surprise
